metadata.title: CVE-2024-5642 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
CPython 3.9 and earlier doesn't disallow configuring an empty list ("[]")for SSLContext.set_npn_protocols() which is an invalid value for theunderlying OpenSSL API. This results in a buffer over-read when NPN is used(see CVE-2024-5535 for OpenSSL). This vulnerability is of low severity dueto NPN being not widely used and specifying an empty list likely beinguncommon in-practice (typically a protocol name would be configured).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-5642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8-examples - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
python3.8-venv - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
python3.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1ubuntu1').
python3.9 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
